document.docAuthor: Indicatti, Rafael P., Lucas, Sylvia M., Guadanucci, José P. L. & Yamamoto, Flávio U.
document.docTitle: Magulla brescoviti Indicatti, Lucas, Guadanucci & Yamamoto, 2008, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: Revalidation and revision of the genus Magulla Simon 1892 (Araneae, Mygalomorphae, Theraphosidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revalidation and revision of the genus Magulla Simon 1892 (Araneae, Mygalomorphae, Theraphosidae)

,
03.III. 2001
( MCTP 19546, 19547, 19548 ).
Etymology: For Antonio D. Brescovit, in honor of his valuable contributions to Brazilian arachnology.

Diagnosis: Males of
M. brescoviti
n. sp.
differ from those of
M. obesa
and
M. buecherli
n. sp.
by the palpal bulb having less developed keels and a ventral curvature in apical portion of embolus (
Fig. 2 F, H
).

Females of
M. brescoviti
n. sp.
differ from those of
M. obesa
by the shorter seminal receptacle with dilated apical portion.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3 . A–F.
M. brescoviti
n. sp.
(MCN 42901). A–B. Right male palpal. A. Prolateral view; B. Detail of low keels, prolateral view; C. Detail male tibial apophyis, prolateral view; D–F. Tarsal trichobothria; D. Trichobothria and tarsal organ. E. Filiform; F. Clavate. Scale bars: Fig. A–D = 100 μm; Figs E–F = 10 μm.

FIGURE 4 . A–E.
Magulla
species, spermathecae. A–C.
Magulla obesa
. A. Dorsal view; B. Lateral view (IBSP 12713); C. Variation, holotype (MNHN 1041), dorsal view. D–E.
M. brescoviti
n. sp.
, paratype (MCN 43291). D. Dorsal view; E. Lateral view. Scale bars = 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation: Males (n= 7 ): total length 11.70–14.40 . Carapace 5.80–7.20 . Cuspules on labium 0–8 , cuspules on endites 65–83 .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 5 . A–I.
Magulla obesa
.
A–C. Male (MNRJ 14996). A. Carapace, dorsal view; B. Abdomen, dorsal view; C. Endites and sternum, ventral view; D–I. Female (IBSP 12713). D. Carapace, dorsal view; E. Abdomen, dorsal view; F. Endites and sternum, ventral view; G. Carapace, lateral view; H–I. Tarsus and metatarsus leg I. H. Retrolateral view; I. Ventral view. Scale bars = 1 mm. Photos: R. P. Indicatti.

subSubSection.paragraph: Note: The shape of the urticating hair patch varies throughout the spider's life, being small and rounded in juveniles and triangular in adults.

Natural History: All specimens were collected at CPCN Pró-Mata, using 10 cm wide pitfall-traps. This site is located in “Serra Geral” (south Brazilian basaltic plateau) southeast border, at altitudes of 600–900 meters. The site is characterized mainly by Mixed Ombrophilous Forest (known as Brazilian Pine Forests or “Floresta de Araucária ”) with savannas at higher altitudes, and Dense Ombrophilous Forests (Atlantic Rainforest) at lower altitude slopes; the climate varies from humid to very humid, with temperatures below 15 ºC during winter season (
Bertoletti & Teixeira 1995
). Spiders were collected in three different forest habitats:
Araucaria angustifolia (Bertol.) O. Kuntze
primary forests; two secondary forests characterized mainly by
Tibouchina sellowiana (Chan.) Cong.
;
Pinus
spp. silvicultures (see
Baaske 2001
). All sampled areas are located in Mixed Ombrophilous Forest domain (
Araucaria angustifolia
) at altitudes around
900 m .
Specimens and ecological data were obtained during field work of R. Ott's doctoral thesis (Programa de Pós-Graduação em Biociências - Zoologia, Faculdade de Biociências, Pontifícia Universidade Católica do Rio Grande do Sul - PUCRS ).
